purpose.summary: This batch COBOL utility program accepts an 8-character parameter from SYSIN representing wait time in centiseconds. It moves the parameter value to the MVSWAIT-TIME field (PIC 9(8) COMP) and calls the MVSWAIT subroutine to execute the wait. The program then terminates with STOP RUN.

inputs.name: PARM-VALUE
inputs.description: 8-character input from SYSIN containing wait time in centiseconds (PIC X(8))

outputs.name: NONE
outputs.description: No explicit output files or data; the program performs a wait operation via MVSWAIT call and terminates

called_programs.purpose: Executes the wait operation for the time specified in MVSWAIT-TIME

business_rules.description: Input parameter must be an 8-character value representing wait time in centiseconds
business_rules.logic_summary: Value accepted from SYSIN into PIC X(8) field and moved to PIC 9(8) COMP field, implying numeric conversion and validation
conditions: PARM-VALUE is numeric for COMP conversion

transforms.transformation_description: Direct MOVE of 8-character string to 9(8) COMP field (implicit numeric conversion)

paragraphs.purpose: Mainline logic: accept parameter from SYSIN, move to MVSWAIT-TIME, call MVSWAIT, and stop run

error_handling.condition: No explicit input validation or CALL failure handling
error_handling.action: None implemented; potential abend on invalid numeric conversion in MOVE or MVSWAIT errors

open_questions.question: What is the exact implementation of the MVSWAIT subroutine?
open_questions.context: MVSWAIT is called statically but its source code is not provided; only inferred from name and usage
open_questions.suggestion: Analyze MVSWAIT source code or runtime behavior to confirm wait mechanism
